dictionary.title: JLPT N1 (doesn't contain the vocab needed by JLPT N1 and below

translations.word: to behave like a spoiled child
the way things are or should be
not very (this form only used as adverb)
1. one copy e.g. of a document
drink!(said repeatedly as a party cheer)
liar (sometimes said with not much seriousness)
first sign of the Chinese calendar
(orig) charcoal brazier in a floor well
actions committed in a former life
Thank you very much for your....
not writing or contacting for a while
to be used to a job
to go to sleep (i.e. a limb)
doing a thing from beginning to end
arrival (in a country at work etc.)
to carry on back or shoulder
local express (train slower than an express)
mystery or detective genre (movie novel etc.)
by all means (with sense of not taking no for an answer)
search (esp. for someone or something missing)
to drop in for a short visit
public position or attitude (as opposed to private thoughts)
to arrive somewhere after a struggle
implying (negatively) that something is full of e.g. mistakes
to add one thing to another
to have no more at hand
(husband and wife) earning a living together
to act as an agent for
hall used for martial arts training
winning a prize or place (in a contest)
to move right ahead (with the work)
counter for nights of a stay
I am glad to meet you
something heard for the first time
to retire to a private place
eighth sign of Chinese zodiac (The Ram 1pm-3pm south-southwest June)
not to work out (ie a deal)
counter for copies of a newspaper or magazine
to deprecate oneself and praise the listener
to come apart at the seams
day care worker in a kindergarten nursery school etc.
fourth sign of Chinese zodiac (The Hare 5am-7am east February)
counter for flat objects (e.g. sheets of paper)
verb suffix to indicate reckless abandon to the activity
to refrain from performing an action
to take an extensive view of
private home providing lodging for travelers
understanding (e.g. please be understanding of the mess during our renovation)
doing something especially rather than incidentally
good sense (for music style tact etc.)
to coincide (fall on the same day)
to repeat a school year after failing

meaning.transcription: デモンストレーション
